compounddef.title: Deprecated Interface for Free Energy Evaluation

briefdescription.para: first pos of second seq for cofolding

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *string, const char *structure, int verbosity_level)
memberdef.name: energy_of_structure

briefdescription.para: Calculate the free energy of an already folded RNA using global model detail settings.

detaileddescription.para: If verbosity level is set to a value >0, energies of structure elements are printed to stdout

simplesect.para: OpenMP: This function relies on several global model settings variables and thus is not to be considered threadsafe. See energy_of_struct_par() for a completely threadsafe implementation.

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence
secondary structure in dot-bracket notation
a flag to turn verbose output on/off

simplesect.para: the free energy of the input structure given the input sequence in kcal/mol

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *string, const char *structure, vrna_param_t *parameters, int verbosity_level)
memberdef.name: energy_of_struct_par

briefdescription.para: Calculate the free energy of an already folded RNA.

detaileddescription.para: If verbosity level is set to a value >0, energies of structure elements are printed to stdout

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence in uppercase letters
Secondary structure in dot-bracket notation
A data structure containing the prescaled energy contributions and the model details.
A flag to turn verbose output on/off

simplesect.para: The free energy of the input structure given the input sequence in kcal/mol

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *string, const char *structure, int m1, int m2)
memberdef.name: energy_of_move

briefdescription.para: Calculate energy of a move (closing or opening of a base pair)

detaileddescription.para: If the parameters m1 and m2 are negative, it is deletion (opening) of a base pair, otherwise it is insertion (opening).

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence
secondary structure in dot-bracket notation
first coordinate of base pair
second coordinate of base pair

simplesect.para: energy change of the move in kcal/mol

memberdef.name: energy_of_struct

detaileddescription.para: Calculate the free energy of an already folded RNA

simplesect.para: This function is not entirely threadsafe! Depending on the state of the global variable eos_debug it prints energy information to stdout or not...

xrefdescription.para: This function is deprecated and should not be used in future programs! Use energy_of_structure() instead!

simplesect.para: energy_of_structure, energy_of_circ_struct(), energy_of_struct_pt()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence
secondary structure in dot-bracket notation

simplesect.para: the free energy of the input structure given the input sequence in kcal/mol

memberdef.argsstring: (int type, int si1, int sj1, int extLoop, vrna_param_t *P)
memberdef.name: E_Stem

briefdescription.para: Compute the energy contribution of a stem branching off a loop-region.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes the energy contribution of a stem that branches off a loop region. This can be the case in multiloops, when a stem branching off increases the degree of the loop but also immediately interior base pairs of an exterior loop contribute free energy. To switch the behavior of the function according to the evaluation of a multiloop- or exterior-loop-stem, you pass the flag 'extLoop'. The returned energy contribution consists of a TerminalAU penalty if the pair type is greater than 2, dangling end contributions of mismatching nucleotides adjacent to the stem if only one of the si1, sj1 parameters is greater than 0 and mismatch energies if both mismatching nucleotides are positive values. Thus, to avoid incorporating dangling end or mismatch energies just pass a negative number, e.g. -1 to the mismatch argument.
This is an illustration of how the energy contribution is assembled: 3' 5' | | X - Y 5'-si1 sj1-3'

Here, (X,Y) is the base pair that closes the stem that branches off a loop region. The nucleotides si1 and sj1 are the 5'- and 3'- mismatches, respectively. If the base pair type of (X,Y) is greater than 2 (i.e. an A-U or G-U pair, the TerminalAU penalty will be included in the energy contribution returned. If si1 and sj1 are both nonnegative numbers, mismatch energies will also be included. If one of si1 or sj1 is a negative value, only 5' or 3' dangling end contributions are taken into account. To prohibit any of these mismatch contributions to be incorporated, just pass a negative number to both, si1 and sj1. In case the argument extLoop is 0, the returned energy contribution also includes the internal-loop-penalty of a multiloop stem with closing pair type.

simplesect.para: This function is threadsafe
E_MLstem(), _ExtLoop()

xrefdescription.para: Please use one of the functions vrna_E_ext_stem() and E_MLstem() instead! Use the former for cases where extLoop != 0 and the latter otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: The pair type of the first base pair un the stem
The 5'-mismatching nucleotide
The 3'-mismatching nucleotide
A flag that indicates whether the contribution reflects the one of an exterior loop or not
The data structure containing scaled energy parameters

simplesect.para: The Free energy of the branch off the loop in dcal/mol

memberdef.argsstring: (int type, int si1, int sj1, vrna_param_t *P)

Use vrna_exp_E_ext_stem() instead!

simplesect.para: E_ExtLoop()
The Boltzmann weighted energy contribution of the introduced exterior-loop stem

memberdef.argsstring: (int type, int si1, int sj1, int extLoop, vrna_exp_param_t *P)

para.heading: Compute the Boltzmann weighted energy contribution of a stem branching off a loop-region

detaileddescription.para: This is the partition function variant of E_Stem()

simplesect.para: This function is threadsafe
The Boltzmann weighted energy contribution of the branch off the loop

memberdef.argsstring: (int n1, int n2, int type, int type_2, int si1, int sj1, int sp1, int sq1, vrna_param_t *P)
memberdef.name: E_IntLoop

para.heading: Compute the Energy of an interior-loop

detaileddescription.para:
This function computes the free energy $\Delta G$ of an interior-loop with the following structure:
3' 5' | | U - V a_n b_1 . . . . . . a_1 b_m X - Y | | 5' 3' This general structure depicts an interior-loop that is closed by the base pair (X,Y). The enclosed base pair is (V,U) which leaves the unpaired bases a_1-a_n and b_1-b_n that constitute the loop. In this example, the length of the interior-loop is $(n+m)$ where n or m may be 0 resulting in a bulge-loop or base pair stack. The mismatching nucleotides for the closing pair (X,Y) are: 5'-mismatch: a_1 3'-mismatch: b_m and for the enclosed base pair (V,U): 5'-mismatch: b_1 3'-mismatch: a_n

simplesect.para: Base pairs are always denoted in 5'->3' direction. Thus the enclosed base pair must be 'turned arround' when evaluating the free energy of the interior-loop This function is threadsafe
scale_parameters(), vrna_param_t

parameterdescription.para: The size of the 'left'-loop (number of unpaired nucleotides)
The size of the 'right'-loop (number of unpaired nucleotides)
The pair type of the base pair closing the interior loop
The pair type of the enclosed base pair
The 5'-mismatching nucleotide of the closing pair
The 3'-mismatching nucleotide of the closing pair
The 3'-mismatching nucleotide of the enclosed pair
The 5'-mismatching nucleotide of the enclosed pair
The datastructure containing scaled energy parameters

simplesect.para: The Free energy of the Interior-loop in dcal/mol

memberdef.argsstring: (int u1, int u2, int type, int type2, short si1, short sj1, short sp1, short sq1, vrna_exp_param_t *P)
memberdef.name: exp_E_IntLoop

para.heading: Compute Boltzmann weight $e^{-\Delta G/kT} $ of interior loop

simplesect.para: This function is threadsafe
get_scaled_pf_parameters(), vrna_exp_param_t, E_IntLoop()

parameterdescription.para: The size of the 'left'-loop (number of unpaired nucleotides)
The size of the 'right'-loop (number of unpaired nucleotides)
The pair type of the base pair closing the interior loop
The pair type of the enclosed base pair
The 5'-mismatching nucleotide of the closing pair
The 3'-mismatching nucleotide of the closing pair
The 3'-mismatching nucleotide of the enclosed pair
The 5'-mismatching nucleotide of the enclosed pair
The datastructure containing scaled Boltzmann weights of the energy parameters

simplesect.para: The Boltzmann weight of the Interior-loop
